content.question: If <math alttext="g" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>g</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> is the function defined by <math alttext="g of x, equals, the fraction with numerator cosine x, minus, sine x, and denominator 1 minus, 2 times sine squared of, x, end fraction" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>g</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><mi>cos</mi><mo>⁡</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>−</mo><mi>sin</mi><mo>⁡</mo><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>1</mn><mo>−</mo><mrow><mn>2</mn><msup><mrow><mi>sin</mi><mo>⁡</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mi>x</mi></mrow></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math>, what is <math alttext="the limit as x approaches pi over 4, of, g of x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><munder><mrow><mi>lim</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>→</mo><mfrac><mrow><mi>π</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></munder><mi>g</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> ?

choices.label: <math alttext="the fraction with numerator 1, and denominator the square root of 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><msqrt><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msqrt></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="the fraction with numerator 1, and denominator the square root of 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><msqrt><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msqrt></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math>

skill.text: Skill 1.C: Identify an appropriate mathematical rule or procedure based on the classification of a given expression (e.g., Use the chain rule to find the derivative of a composite function).
